learning_outcomes.description: Use their knowledge and expertise to evaluate biomanufacturing technologies and trouble shoot expression technologies.
Critically analyse and evaluate new biomanufacturing processes.

Identify and explain the downstream processing required for large scale manufacture of a biological molecule with an understanding of the purpose and importance of each stage of the manufacturing process.
Perform and analyse data generated using key analytical techniques critical in the evaluation of biomanufacturing products and procedures.
Identify the requirements of cGMP in biomanufacturing and critically evaluate scenarios and case studies for compliance to these standards.

assessments.task_description:
An in-class invigilated written exam will examine Modules 1 and 2 material.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
The Centrally run End of Semester Exam will occur during Exam period and will cover Modules 3 and 4 material only.

Use of Artificial Intelligence (AI) and Machine Translation (MT)

This assessment task is to be completed in-person. The use of generative Artificial Intelligence (AI) or Machine Translation (MT) tools will not be permitted. Any attempted use of AI or MT may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

learning_activities.topic:
Site visits and case studies

Class visits to one or more industrial biomanufacturing sites will be arranged. Real life case studies and scenarios will be explored on these visits.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
